div.p: P79/8897, unit 1099, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.1972in; margin-right: 1.2591in; text-align: center; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: MS written by G. Luehmann and signed by M. The alterations noted below are in a different hand, probably that of somebody in the Chief Secretary's Office.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.1972in; margin-right: 1.2591in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: To the Honorable the Chief Secretary

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.1972in; margin-right: 1.2591in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.1972in; margin-right: 1.2591in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
I have the honor to submit for approval the following Estimate* of Expenditure during the two months
two crossed out, replaced by one.
ending 31st December
31st December crossed out, replaced by 30th November .
1879.

font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: The entries for the items 'Paper for lithograms' and 'Towards Flora Australiensis' have been crossed out. M had earlier sought permission to use the latter allocation to employ a collector, or 'the purchase of plants purposelly collected' (see M to W. Odgers, 27 September 1879) and, it would appear, had already spent some money in that way. Since the 7th and final volume of Flora australiensis had appeared in March 1878, such expenditure could only have been justified as being directed towards the preparation of the envisaged supplementary volume, which was never in fact published.

cell.p: Total — Three hundred and thirty eight pounds six shillings and eight pence

cell.p:
8
This figure was first reduced to 325 16 8, corresponding to the deletion of the item for 'Paper for Lithograms', and then reduced to 164 following the changing of all figures to cover one month's expenditure rather than two.
